intro: Barleria eranthemoides, commonly known as the African shieldflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a bushy appearance with opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, blooming from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period and drought tolerance.
